job_description: Job Title/positionFinancial Services - Senior Audit ManagerNumber Of Positions2Function And Business UnitFinancial Services - BankingDescription Description of the role and purpose of the job: The Financial Services Audit division provides audit services to the largest banking clients in South Africa. Audit managers are required to guide, manage and oversee the planning, staffing and supervision of audits of large banking clients. We aim to provide clients with audits of the highest quality that add value to their business.Key Responsibilities Manage and oversee the planning and running of a large audit of a bank/division of a bank. Engagement with group auditors/fellow joint auditors with respect to cross reviews/ISA 600 responsibilities on audit matters. Liaise with specialists, including actuaries, tax professionals and IT auditors regarding their involvement and scope on the engagement and determining the impact on the audit approach of any findings they might raise Provide IFRS technical, audit operational and audit quality leadership with a focus on professional scepticism Presenting audit findings relating to the respective engagement to clients as well as assisting with audit committee document submission. Management of staff with respect to equitable planning of resources and ensuring that teams are adequately transformed Demonstrate a strong tone and culture supporting audit quality through a commitment to maintain objectivity, professional scepticism, ethics and integrity. Have the operational accountability and responsibility to drive audit quality in response to the needs of stakeholders and external regulators Reviewing the work performed by junior resources to ensure that the various audit risk factors have been accurately addressed and documented Communicate with the highest levels of staff at the client Take commercial and contractual responsibility for managing engagement billings, collections and identification of overrun opportunities Skills And Attributes Required For The Role Deep understanding of the audit risks within a banking environment Good organisation skills Able to see the bigger picture Strong leader Team player Ability to work under pressure Good communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills Up to date with financial services industry knowledge and processes, auditing standards and global best practice templates Enthusiasm, individual initiative with self-drive Minimum requirements to apply for the role (including qualifications and experience): CA (SA) or equivalent qualification, and has at least 5 years of experience since completion of training contract. job_title: Assistant Director of People & Culture (Human Resources)- For Radisson Blu Chattogram Bay View- Job ID: 1454968

job_description: Job SummaryThe jobholder (2-year contract) provides strategic leadership in shaping and executing the organisation’s people strategy. The role oversees all HR functions while leading organisation development initiatives to build a high-performing, future-ready, and values-driven workforce aligned with the organisation’s mission and long-term goals.The incumbent is expected to work between 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. on weekdays and may be required to work over weekends and on public holidays to support in organisation events. Although he/she is expected to work in an indoor environment, he/she is also expected to travel out of office for meetings.Key Responsibility AreasStrategic HR Leadershipa. Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and frameworks aligned with organisational objectives.b. Lead HR governance, ensuring compliance with employment legislation, HR best practices, and organisational policies.c. Drive a strong organisational culture grounded in shared values, performance excellence, and employee engagement.d . Keep abreast of national and sectorial regulations, development, and trends for incorporation into internal processes.Organisation Development (OD)a. Lead organisation development initiatives including organisational design, workforce transformation, change management, and succession planning.b. Partner business leaders to support change initiatives, mergers, restructuring, or transformation programmes.c. Design and implement leadership development and talent management frameworks to build leadership succession plans.d. Facilitate culture-building initiatives, employee engagement strategies, and values integration across the organisation.Learning and Developmenta. Set strategic direction for learning and development initiatives, including leadership programmes, capability building, and skills upgrading.b. Ensure alignment of learning strategies with organisational priorities and future skills requirements.c. Promote a culture of continuous learning and development.Employee Relations and Engagementa. Oversee employee relations, ensuring fair, consistent, and timely handling of grievances, disciplinary matters, and workplace issues.b. Champion employee engagement initiatives and ensure regular measurement and follow-up on engagement outcomes.b. Formulate organisation’s rewards philosophy that includes employee value propositions, non-monetary rewards and performance based monetary rewards to motivate workforce and drive high performance.People and Team Leadershipa. Lead, mentor, and develop the HR team to deliver high-quality HR and OD services.b. Build strong partnerships with internal stakeholders across all levels of the organisation.HR Operations and Systemsa. Oversee HR operations, policies, compensation and benefits, payroll, and HR Management systems.b. Drive HR digitalisation and process improvement to enhance efficiency and employee experiencec. Manage HR budgets and ensure cost-effective use of resources.In achieving the above, the incumbent will work under the direct and close guidance of the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and with the support of the relevant support departments. He/She may also perform any other duties as directed and assigned by the CEO.Requirementsa. Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, Organisation Development, or a related field.b. Postgraduate qualification or professional certification (e.g. IHRP, SHRM, CIPD, OD certification) is highly desirablec. 10 to 15 years of progressive HR experience, including senior leadership responsibilities.d. Proven experience in organisation development, including organisational design, change management, and workforce transformation.e. Strong track record in strategic HR leadership, advising senior management and/or Board-level stakeholders.f· Hands-on experience across the full HR lifecycle (talent acquisition, performance management, L&D, succession planning, employee relations).g· Familiarity with HR governance, employment legislation, and best practices. job_description: Client: Confidential Position: Chief Financial OfficerReports to: Chief Executive OfficerLocation: Toronto, ON COMPANY This organization is a well-established and highly respected investment management platform with a diverse and expanding portfolio, including interests in alternative investments, private capital markets, and growth-stage operating companies. The firm is recognized for its entrepreneurial culture, commitment to innovation, and a strong track record of value creation for clients and stakeholders.The platform manages a range of investment vehicles, including structured funds and exchange-listed entities, and is known for its disciplined, research-driven approach to portfolio management. Its leadership team brings deep expertise in direct lending, private equity, and capital markets, and has successfully navigated complex transactions such as mergers, acquisitions, and international expansion initiatives.Among its portfolio are companies operating in regulated growth industries and emerging sectors, with a focus on supporting businesses beyond the start-up phase and positioning them for scalable growth. The organization is also committed to providing accredited investors with access to unique private market opportunities, leveraging innovative structures to deliver differentiated returns. With a reputation for strong governance, fiduciary oversight, and a collaborative, agile work environment, the firm continues to attract top talent and strategic partners as it enters its next phase of expansion.THE OPPORTUNITYWe are seeking a strategic, commercially minded Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to help drive its next phase of growth. The successful candidate will serve as a proactive business partner to the executive team, bringing deep expertise in fund operations, M&A, and portfolio oversight, and will play a pivotal role in shaping financial strategy and governance across the organization.This is a rare and confidential opportunity for an accomplished finance executive to join a high-performing executive team at a pivotal moment of growth and transformation. The incoming CFO will move beyond traditional stewardship to provide forward-thinking financial leadership, drive enterprise value, and support the organization’s continued expansion.SKILLS & COMPETENCIESStrategic financial leadership and business partnership.Hands-on operational expertise in small-cap public company environments, with a proven ability to manage end-to-end finance operations, including financial reporting, compliance, and internal controls.Deep expertise in fund and investment company financial operations.Advanced knowledge of M&A execution, due diligence, and integration.Strong command of portfolio company oversight and fund-level structuring.Ability to contribute to the financial side of the sales process, including trade execution and compliance.Consultative approach, offering actionable insights to shape business decisions.High energy, agility, and a proactive, solutions-oriented mindset.Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills.Commercial acumen and a track record of driving business growth.EXPERIENCESenior finance executive experience, ideally as CFO or in a senior finance leadership role within investment management, private equity, hedge funds, or small publicly traded companiesDirect operational experience in small publicly traded companies, including responsibility for financial statement preparation, regulatory reporting, and day-to-day finance functions. Demonstrated ability to step into the role and immediately add value with minimal onboarding.Demonstrated success in M&A, portfolio oversight, and fund structuringExperience supporting entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and high-growth environmentsProven ability to implement robust financial governance while enabling business agilityTrack record of contributing to business development and enterprise value creationEDUCATION & CERTIFICATIONSCPA or CA designation is requiredPreference for candidates who began their careers in audit at a major accounting firmAdditional relevant professional qualifications or advanced degrees are considered an assetLEADERSHIP COMPETENCIESStrategic thinker with the ability to translate vision into actionable financial strategiesCollaborative leader who builds strong relationships across executive and operational teamsChange agent who drives continuous improvement and embraces innovationHigh integrity and discretion, with a commitment to confidentiality and ethical leadershipResults-oriented, with a focus on impact, accountability, and shared success.About LHH Knightsbridge – www.lhhknightsbridge.comLHH helps organizations simplify the complexity associated with transforming their leadership and workforce so they can accelerate results, with less risk. job_description: Job Type: Remote ( Non Paid )only for students who are looking to learn and get experiencedCompany Description YouthBees, founded on April 21, 2021, is an e-learning platform dedicated to empowering youth by offering opportunities to learn and develop new skills. With over 500 active members and campus ambassadors from renowned institutions across Bangladesh, YouthBees is a thriving online learning community. The organization fosters an inclusive environment where individuals of all experience levels are welcome to participate in various events and activities. Guided by its vision to develop a world full of creative minds, YouthBees strives to help young people become productive, knowledgeable, and competent members of the workforce. Role Description This is a full-time on-site role for a Junior Student HR Representative at YouthBees, located in Gulshan. The Junior Student HR will assist in implementing HR policies, managing recruitment processes, and onboarding new members. Key responsibilities include maintaining records, coordinating with campus ambassadors, organizing member development programs, and addressing inquiries related to HR policies and procedures. The candidate will also support team-building initiatives and play a pivotal role in enhancing the overall member experience. job_description: This job is with Thermo Fisher Scientific, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly. Work ScheduleStandard (Mon-Fri)Environmental ConditionsOfficeJob DescriptionJoin Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. as a Manager, Accounts Payable in Sofia!Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $40 billion. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer. From advancing life sciences research and solving complex analytical challenges to improving diagnostics and driving laboratory efficiency, we empower our customers with innovative technologies and services.Within Thermo Fisher, our Global Business Services (GBS) Shared Services team is transforming how we work, optimizing processes, and driving productivity. With over 2300+ colleagues across five global locations, including our Sofia site, we deliver scalable, cost-effective solutions. Since its establishment in 2013, the Sofia Finance Shared Services center has been operating for over 10 years with a proven track of record of success and growth and is designed to serve our global customers across various financial functions, including Procure to Pay, Record to Report and Order to Cash.Key ResponsibilitiesProvide strategic and operational leadership to the global Accounts Payable teams, including regional teams, supervisors, and senior specialists.Oversee end-to-end AP operations, ensuring accurate and timely processing of invoices, payments, and vendor queries across multiple legal entities and regions.Develop, implement, and monitor SLAs, KPIs, and performance dashboards to ensure operational excellence and accountability.Drive global process standardization, automation (e.g., RPA, AI-enabled OCR), and continuous improvement across invoice-to-pay processes.Collaborate with Procurement, Finance, Treasury, and Compliance teams to optimize P2P performance, working capital, and risk management.Ensure adherence to internal controls (SOX), tax and regulatory requirements, and corporate policies, especially in highly regulated environments (e.g., clinical research).Manage internal and external audit requirements; support statutory, group, and management reporting as needed.Lead and develop a high-performing AP team; coach and mentor direct reports and identify future leadership talent.Lead or support global transformation projects, ERP rollouts, business transitions, and M&A integrations.Represent the AP function in governance forums, business reviews, and stakeholder engagements at senior levels.Basic RequirementsUniversity degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or related discipline; professional certification (e.g., ACCA, CPA, CIMA) preferred.8–10 years of progressive experience in Accounts Payable or P2P, with at least 3 years in a people management or leadership role.Strong understanding of global P2P operating models, controls, compliance frameworks (e.g., SOX, GDPR), and tax implications (e.g., VAT, WHT).Proven experience managing large, distributed teams in a shared services or multinational environment.Demonstrated ability to lead process optimization, automation, and change initiatives.Strong interpersonal, stakeholder management, and communication skills, with experience engaging senior leadership and cross-functional partners.ERP proficiency (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Coupa, Ariba) and familiarity with payment and invoice automation tools.We are seeking a dedicated professional with a keen attention to detail and strong financial analysis skills. The ideal candidate will excel in vendor relationship management and place a high emphasis on continuous improvement. This role requires effective team leadership and collaboration, along with adaptability to changing environments. We value ethical conduct and are looking for someone who embodies these principles in their work.Why Thermo Fisher Scientific?We pride ourselves on our inclusive and collaborative culture, where every voice is valued, and ideas are encouraged. We believe that diversity and inclusion are essential for fostering innovation and driving business success. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing a workplace that is free from discrimination and harassment.Apply today and be part of a company that is making a difference!Join us in our mission to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer.]]>

job_description: About Lagride (Subsidi: LagRide Nigeria Limited is a forward-thinking e-hailing company transforming urban mobility through innovative, technology-driven, and sustainable transportation solutions. As a proudly indigenous brand, we are committed to delivering safe, reliable, and affordable ride services while building strong partnerships with corporate and institutional clients across Nigeria.Job Summary: The B2B Key Account Supervisor is responsible for managing, growing, and retaining LagRide’s corporate (B2B) client portfolio. The role focuses on relationships management, service delivery oversight, contract performance, and revenue growth. The Supervisor serves as the primary point of contact for assigned key accounts, ensuring service-level compliance, resolving escalations, and collaborating internally to deliver tailored mobility solutions that meet client business needs. Key Responsibilities: Serve as the primary relationship manager for assigned B2B and corporate accounts. Onboard new corporate clients and ensure smooth implementation of agreed services and SLAs. Monitor account performance against contractual obligations, KPIs, and service level agreements. Actively manage client expectations, handle escalations, and resolve service issues promptly. Conduct regular account reviews with clients to assess satisfaction, usage trends, and improvement opportunities. Identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities to grow account value and revenue. Coordinate with Operations, Driver Management, Finance, and Customer Support teams to ensure seamless service delivery. Prepare and present periodic account performance reports, insights, and recommendations. Support contract renewals, negotiations, and pricing discussions in collaboration with management. Maintain accurate account documentation, records, and CRM updates. RequirementsQualifications and Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Management, or a related field. 3–5 years of experience in B2B account management, key account supervision, or corporate client servicing. Strong understanding of B2B relationship management and service-level management. Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret usage, cost, and performance data. Ability to manage multiple accounts and priorities under pressure. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and CRM/account management tools. Experience in mobility, logistics, fintech, or service-based industries is an advantage. Key Performance Indicators: Client retention rate and contract renewal success. Revenue growth and wallet share per key account. SLA compliance and service performance metrics. Client satisfaction score (CSAT) and feedback ratings. Average resolution time for B2B escalations and issues. Upsell and cross-sell conversion rates. Accuracy and timeliness of account reporting. Benefits Competitive salary and performance-based incentives. Health and wellness benefits (HMO). Career growth and professional development opportunities. A collaborative, innovative, and performance-driven work environment. Opportunity to play a key role in scaling LagRide’s B2B business. Show more Show less

About : Action contre la FaimCreated in 1979, Action contre la Faim is a non-governmental organization that fights against hunger. Its charter of humanitarian principals- independence, neutrality, non-discrimination, free and direct access to victims, professionalism, transparency - has been part of its identity for 45 years. Its mission is to save lives by eliminating hunger through the prevention, detection and treatment of under-nutrition, particularly during and after emergency situations linked to conflicts or natural disasters. Action contre la Faim focuses its actions on 7 main areas of expertise: Nutrition and Health - Mental Health, Psychosocial Support - Food Security and Livelihoods - Water, Sanitation and Hygiene - Advocacy - Climate - Research. In 2023, Action contre la Faim provided aid to 21 million people in nearly 51 countries worldwide. www.actioncontrelafaim.orgMissionUnder the supervision of the Head of Finance Department, you will be responsible for the overall management of the mission financial portfolio for effective and efficient financial management, in line with the Action Against Hunger financial guidelines and donor rules and regulations.Your Missions Will Be ToContribute to the definition of mission strategy and development of budget and proposal frameworkEnsure effective account management and financial reporting for the missionOversee the cash management for the missionEnsure financial and budgetary managementPromote and ensure financial collaboration and coordination with mission partnersEnsure financial risk management and continuous improvement of financial proceduresMentor support, capacity building and performance managementSupport 3 Field Offices (Maiduguri, Yobe, Sokoto) and 2 operations in Jigawa and YolaManage 2 people directly (DHOD and Accountant) and 3 indirectly (Finance Managers)Start date : 01/03/2026ProfileYou hold a Degree in Accounting/Finance with a proven experience (5 years), including experience with SAGA accounting system and at least 3 years in a managing complex, large-scale grant portfolios, backed by a solid understanding of humanitarian accounting standards, organizational code of conduct, and the operational dynamics of NGO field environments.You are familiar with donor regulations, compliance, frameworks and the Nigerian mission context, and you are able to ensure high-quality financial stewardship and accountability.Experience with Action Against Hunger's systems and operational approaches is an asset.You have a good command of written and spoken English.Conditions d'emploiVaccination against Mpox is recommended for employees traveling to this country.Fixed term contract under French legislation:?7 months until 30/09/2026Monthly gross salary from 2597 to 2968euros upon experience, ?including 13th monthReimbursement of the pension insurance for non-French citizens: 16% of the gross monthly salaryAnnual salary increase: 6% increase after and each 12 months of continuous contractMonthly per diem and living allowance: 837$?net, field paidMonthly country allowance: 150eurosChild allowance: 1500euros per year per child present in the country of origin (maximum 6000euros/year)Transportation and accommodation: Coverage of transportation costs and guest houseMedical coverage: ACF covers 100% of the health and repatriation insurance agreement fees, for your medical expenses (as well as your dependents if you have a family post), and up to 1 month after the end of your contract.Salary sustainment measures (sickness, paternity, maternity)Leaves and RnR: 25 days of paid leaves per year, 20 RnR per year, airfare reimbursement with a ceiling to get to the chosen break destination, and 215 euros for each RnR job_description: Job DescriptionParcelhero Group, founded in 2003, is a leading UK parcel delivery price comparison site, attracting over 5 million visitors annually. As a dynamic and forward-thinking technology company, with over 130 remote employees worldwide, we are on a strong growth trajectory.Driven by our commitment to innovative solutions and exceptional customer care, we offer excellent career growth opportunities, particularly as we continue to expand rapidly. We are now launching our new product, Parcelhero Pro, for DTC e-commerce merchants across the UK and the USA. This cutting-edge platform will empower retailers to streamline their shipping and fulfilment operations.Our remote-first culture is collaborative and innovative, where every voice is heard, and we encourage initiative, adaptability, and ownership. If youre a dynamic and ambitious individual seeking a forward-thinking team, Parcelhero is the ideal fit.Our Core Values: Committed to Quality | Create Amazing Experiences | Putting People First | Welcome Feedback | Inform, Educate, Innovate | Work Hard, Play HardThe role in a nutshellWe are seeking an enthusiastic and highly motivated Credit Controller with B2B & B2C credit control experience (Predominantly B2B). The role involves both chasing debts by phone and email, and also working with the operations team to investigate and solve queries blocking payment being made.Excellent communication skills and diplomacy are an essential part of this key role. Experience with Xero is an advantage. You will support the Finance Team with a range of administrative duties to ensure accurate and up to date record keeping.You will also be working on preparation and submission of our legal cases for unpaid debts, so a keen eye for detail and strong organisational skills are a must.ResponsibilitiesCredit ControlAccount ReconciliationPreparation & submission of legal casesOther general bookkeeping tasksAccount and risk analysisReportingYour ExperienceFluent EnglishMinimum 5 years’ B2B credit control experienceBookkeeping experience an advantageExperience of Xero accounting system an advantageConsumer collection experience an advantageShould have a good typing speed and be able to easily learn new IT systemsMust have an excellent telephone manner and be comfortable dealing with customer queriesYour mindsetA can-do attitude - Enthusiastically proactive, youre a problem solver willing to dive in and learn.Methodical - you think of the best approach to perform a task before you dive inAttention to detail -You have flawless attention to detailA people person -Youre a strong team player with high empathy. You communicate clearly, bringing integrity, honesty, and accountability to everything you do. The package:15 days of holiday8 paid bank holidaysYour birthday offNote: you will need to supply your own IT equipmentWork at Parcelhero: Perks That Pack a Punch!Fully remote: Lose the commute and enjoy a better work live balanceAnnual leave: Generous holiday entitlement, giving you the time you need to rest and rechargePaid Holidays: Enjoy paid leave on all public holidaysMerit Reviews: Get rewarded for your hard work and dedication with regular performance and salary reviewsInclusive Culture: Be yourself and thrive in our casual and upbeat environmentSave on tax: You are paid as a contractor, and responsible for your own tax - many countries offer favourable tax regimes for contractorsParcelhero is an equal-opportunity employer. job_description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking an experienced Quality Control Manager to oversee our quality assurance operations at the facility. This pivotal role involves maintaining high standards of product quality, implementing effective quality control processes, and ensuring compliance with industry regulations. The Quality Control Manager will be responsible for leading a dedicated team of quality control specialists and technicians to identify defects and ensure excellence in our processes. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and a keen eye for detail. With a substantial understanding of quality management systems and a commitment to continuous improvement, the Quality Control Manager will ensure the company's products meet or exceed customer expectations and industry standards.ResponsibilitiesOversee and ensure adherence to rigorous quality control processes and procedures.Lead a team of quality control technicians in executing quality checks and inspections.Develop and implement product quality assurance strategies and compliance measures.Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.Analyze quality control data and generate reports highlighting areas for improvement.Collaborate with production teams to identify quality improvement opportunities.Manage customer complaints and implement corrective action plans promptly.Train and mentor quality control staff, ensuring up-to-date skill sets and compliance.Coordinate with suppliers to ensure materials meet quality specifications.Maintain updated and accurate documentation of quality control procedures and results.Implement best practices for quality assurance to achieve zero defect objectives.Promote a culture of quality throughout the organization at all levels.RequirementsBachelor's degree in Quality Assurance, Engineering, or a related discipline.Proven experience as a Quality Control Manager or in a similar leadership role.Extensive knowledge of quality management systems and compliance standards.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with detail-oriented focus.Excellent leadership skills and ability to manage and motivate a team.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills for effective reporting.Proficiency in quality control tools and relevant industry software applications.Job DetailsRole Level: Mid-Level Work Type: Full-Time Country: United Arab Emirates City: Abu Dhabi Company Website: https://www.talentmate.com Job Function: Quality Assurance & Control job_description: Göz sağlığı alanında fark yaratan bir ekibin parçası olmak ister misiniz?Türkiye’nin ilk ve en büyük göz sağlığı hastaneler zinciri olan Dünyagöz Hastaneler Grubu olarak 1996’dan bu yana göz sağlığında öncü rol üstleniyor, bugün Türkiye’de 21 ve yurtdışında 10 olmak üzere 31 farklı noktada, göz sağlığında mükemmeliyet anlayışıyla büyümeye devam ediyoruz. Şimdi, bu yolculuğumuza katkı sağlayacak yeni ekip arkadaşımızı arıyoruz.Dünyagöz Hastaneler Grubu, Ataköy Şubesi'nde görevlendirilmek üzere "Microsoft Dynamics AX 365 F&O Proje Yöneticisi & İş Analisti” arayışımız mevcuttur.Gerekli NiteliklerTercihen Üniversitelerin Endüstri, İşletme ve Yönetim Bilişim Sistemleri vb. bölümlerinden mezun,Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O en az 1 Erp proje geçişi tecrübesine sahip,Teknik literatürü takip edecek seviyede İngilizce bilen,Yazılı ve sözlü iletişim becerisi yüksek, takım çalışmasına yatkın,Esnek çalışma saatlerine uyabilecek,Erkek adaylar için askerlik hizmetini tamamlamış.İş TanımıMicrosoft Dynamics AX 2009 / 2012 ortamlarındaki geliştirmelerin Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O ortamına uyarlanması,Kurum süreçlerinin analiz edilmesi, tasarlanması ve testlerinin yapılması,Geliştirilen kodların teknik ve uygulama testlerinde yer alınması, analiz ve tasarım dokümanlarının hazırlanması,Microsoft Dynamics AX 365 F&O ile dış sistemlerin entegrasyonu için gerekli analiz tasarım vb. çalışmalarının yapılması. job_description: Job Title: Finance OfficerPosition: Full TimeLocation: Remote (Nepal)Experience: 3-5 yearsAbout Code Mantra:Code Mantra is a fast-growing online education technology company under NextGen Genius LLC, teaching coding, STEM, entrepreneurship, and public speaking to kids aged 5–18. We aim to empower the next generation to become creators, builders, and problem solvers.As Finance Officer, you will be a strategic partner to the CEO, driving financial strategy, operational excellence, and scalable processes to support rapid growth and student acquisition targets.Key Responsibilities:Strategic Finance & LeadershipDevelop, implement, and oversee financial strategy to support growth targets.Partner with CEO and leadership team to provide financial insight for business decisions.Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing finance team (accounting, analysts, bookkeeping).Establish KPIs, dashboards, and reporting structures to monitor business health.Accounting & ReportingOversee full-cycle accounting: P&L, balance sheet, cash flow, and monthly/quarterly close.Ensure compliance with U.S. GAAP, state, and federal tax laws.Manage audits, financial statements, and regulatory filings.Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)Prepare annual budgets, quarterly forecasts, and rolling cash flow models.Monitor actual performance vs. budget and provide actionable recommendations.Analyze student acquisition cost (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), and pricing models.Cash Flow & Risk ManagementMonitor tuition inflows, payment gateways, and refunds.Ensure liquidity, plan for growth investments, and manage burn rate.Implement internal controls, compliance policies, and risk mitigation strategies.Fundraising & Investment (if applicable)Support fundraising efforts: grants, loans, or investor relations.Provide financial due diligence and projections for investors or partners.Legal Advisory & ComplianceOversee corporate governance, entity structuring, and legal documentation.Draft, review, and negotiate contracts with vendors, partners, and stakeholders.Ensure compliance with employment laws, international regulations, and data privacy standards (COPPA, GDPR, FERPA).Advise leadership on legal risks, liabilities, and dispute resolution.Manage intellectual property (IP) protection, trademarks, and licensing.Coordinate with external counsel for complex litigation or cross-border legal issues.Required Qualifications:3 to 5 years of finance experience, with at least 1 years in a leadership role.Strong background in accounting, FP&A, and financial reporting.Experience in EdTech, SaaS, or subscription-based business models preferred.Expertise in cash flow management, budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling.Familiarity with U.S. tax regulations and compliance.Hands-on with QuickBooks, Xero, or NetSuite, Google Sheets/Excel, and BI tools (Google Data Studio, Tableau, Power BI).Key Traits:Strategic thinker and problem solver.Detail-oriented with high integrity and confidentiality.Strong leadership and communication skills.Ability to work in a fast-growing startup environment.KPIs / Success MetricsAccurate and timely monthly/quarterly financial reporting.Student acquisition cost (CAC) tracked and optimized.Cash flow stability: runway, burn rate, and collections.Revenue forecasting accuracy (variance ≤ 5%).Compliance: zero regulatory or tax violations.Timely onboarding and performance management of finance team.Why Join Code MantraLead finance strategy for a mission-driven, fast-growing EdTech startup.Opportunity to build scalable processes and a high-impact finance team.Work with a passionate team shaping the next generation of innovators.
